utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: I'm gonna be so far away.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: I don't care. I don't want to break up. I'll come on the weekends.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Stanford's on the other side of the country.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: My dad has, like, ten million frequent flyer miles. He won't care.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Uh, yes, Mr. Damon. I just had something caught in my throat.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Oh, it's just water. I have a cough. I didn't want to disturb anyone.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: I never knew you were such a good liar.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Well, a little more vodka, and you might find out some more things you didn't know about me.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Mr Damon
utterance.content: Nicholas.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Yes, sir?

utterance.speaker: Mr Damon
utterance.content: What conclusions can we draw from the incredible number of stars?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: That the movie's either gonna be really good or really bad.

utterance.speaker: Mr Damon
utterance.content: I was thinking more about the implications for extraterrestrial life.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Well, I guess if there's an infinite number of stars, odds are there's at least one galaxy with life other than our own

utterance.speaker: Mr Damon
utterance.content: Or

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Or... not?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: The question then becomes, "could you possibly teach us anything more useless?" What are you looking at? Nick: Abby? Oh, my God. Something's wrong. She's not breathing. Abby?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Would you mind at least putting a napkin under your jelly toast?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get a table, and I won't eat it on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, you will.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But I won't have a good excuse.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why don't you go get a table?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not my condo.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have my permission. Pick out whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then it would be a reflection of me, not you. That wouldn't be right.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, it would be a reflection of the fact that the guy who's been mooching off of me for as long as I can remember, isn't a complete ingrate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You've never furnished a home.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I have furnished a bunch of homes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you've married a bunch of women, who furnished a bunch of homes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You want to eat off something? Fine. Move your piano in here and eat off that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're afraid.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Of a dining table? You know, they don't actually come to life when you put a knob off your bedpost on them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You are what you sit in. Your friends, your job, your furnishings — it all defines you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You don't really believe that. You just don't want to do the shopping.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Buy some furniture, or admit that you're empty inside.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: X-rays confirm the fluid that almost suffocated her to death was from pulmonary edema.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Means the problem's either in her heart or lungs.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Tox screen's clean for everything except the alcohol, and her B.A.C. was barely .05.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That means she only had one or two drinks, tops.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And there's no sign of trauma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How'd you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because if there was, Cuddy wouldn't have needed me to take the case.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: How do you know Cuddy…?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Foreman's the only one with the balls to take a case without checking with me, and he's still working on breakfast. Which means that the... 18... no, 17-year-old honor student —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Cuddy has a soft spot for smart girls, and they don't start drinking until second semester, senior year.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So either you think that smart women look out for each other, which means you're an idiot, or you think Cuddy's not smart, which means... well, I guess it's the same both ways.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Then how did you —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Picture fell out of the file. She looks smart. Where's Taub?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You don't already know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, he's at home in a fight with his wife. I'm just curious what he wanted me to know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His car has a flat tire. He's waiting for a tow truck.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What about rising blood pressure from binge drinking? It could set off a hypertensive crisis, cause heart failure.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Two drinks is hardly a binge.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Certainly not if you're an Aussie. But when an American schoolgirl has two drinks before 10:00 am, it's a pretty sure bet that the plan is to have a lot more. Probably wasn't the first time she had that plan.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We'll get a C-13-pyruvate MRI to check for cardiac lactic-acid levels.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Someone call Taub. Tell him to cut the ball and chain on his own time.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We're arguing about couples yoga?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. We're arguing over the fact that we don't ever do anything together anymore.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We don't ever do anything together?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chris, I love you, but I swear, if you start talking to me like I'm on the witness stand again, I'm gonna break your neck.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Honey, we do stuff together all the time.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? Like what? Besides sleeping, watching tv, going out to dinner, what do we do together, just the two of us?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We... You don't like going out to dinner? All right, I'll do the yoga.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Now you don't want me to do it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Just go to work.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. I'm not leaving until we work this out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm fine. Please, just go.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Where's Abby Nash? I'm Nick, her boyfriend. This is my dad.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You can wait in —

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Where is she? Is she okay?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's having some tests run.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Is she okay?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We think her drinking may have damaged her heart.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Her heart? No, she doesn't drink, not that much.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Just when she's at school?

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Nick, what's he talking about?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: It was a field trip. One of the kids had a fake I.D. But dad, you know Abby. Tell him.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Well, I know what she's like when the two of you are around me, but...

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If you're right, the tests will come back negative.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Can you give her a message? I brought her homework... and I love her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry I'm late. Nick loves you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House doesn't believe you got a flat tire.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What does he think I was doing?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Fighting with the wife.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why would I lie about that? She wants me to do yoga.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need thinner cuts.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: When you and Cameron had disagreements —

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm probably not, the best guy to go to for marital advice.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry. It's just —

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Punch in to the mitral valve.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: All right, I get the message.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No — no, I'm serious. What is that?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Could be a fungus.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: E.R. drew blood cultures — all negative, no parasites, no fungus.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It could be fastidious enteric bacteria.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think she's been eating your wife's cooking? Hey, I'm on your side, man.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I am not fighting with my wife. I had a flat tire. It's in my trunk. You can go look at it if you want.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't need to. Face tells me you're bluffing. Not yours — Chase's.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If she was infected through the intestinal tract, she'd have intestinal symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There are other ways to get enteric bacteria into the bloodstream.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's not an intravenous drug user, she has no tattoos, and she doesn't have any scars that would indicate she's a cutter.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Transesophageal Echo could give us a better idea of what we're looking at.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If that valve is about to dehisce, echo could trigger a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So come up with a better idea or have a crash cart ready.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Why are you lying to House? Chase told me. What's the big deal?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Maybe we can talk about this another time... or never.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I really don't think she's gonna tell anyone.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If I admit we're fighting, he's gonna want to know what about.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So tell him, or tell him it's none of his business.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is easier.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Really? Because it seems much harder. What do I know? I'm not a guy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes... If only I could be as open about my emotional life as you are.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's not about the yoga.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Really? I thought it was, since we spent an hour talking about yoga, but what do I know? I'm not a girl.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: My guess is she thinks you don't want to spend time with her because you're spending it with someone else.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If she thinks I'm cheating, she would ask.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Because you'd tell the truth?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not seeing anyone else.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Doesn't matter. You have a history. And that's not her fault.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So what am I supposed to do? I can't prove a negative.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That is a problem.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: There's the heart.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Valves look fine — no vegetations, no myxomatous changes.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Can you give her a little more sedative?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She's dissecting.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She's rupturing. Get the scope out.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Aah!

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This doesn't make sense. Her B.P. is normal, and her heart rate was controlled.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We'll figure it out later. We've only got about 30 seconds to get her open.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No leakage from cannulation site.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Let's see if she'll start up.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Cardiac paddle.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Charging. And go.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Again.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pushing five ccs adrenaline. Zap her again.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's not working. Clear. Clear.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Normal sinus rhythm.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: T.E.E. and intra-operative visualization showed no vegetations on the valves, no structural abnormalities.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The dissection means we were wrong about alcohol causing a hypertensive crisis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And by "we" you mean "you."

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. You were the one who didn't have any better ideas.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not my fault. I was busy trying to judge Taub.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Since we already ruled out trauma, the dissection's probably a genetic defect.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're running the tests. She's not marfanoid.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What about an allergy? A severe enough one could set off a systemic immune reaction, cause fluid in the lungs, and inflammation that could weaken the aorta.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If it was an allergy, she'd be getting better in the hospital, not worse.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Unless it was inside her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Meaning?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: You want my sperm?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We think a severe allergic reaction could be causing systemic breakdown.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: To my son's sperm?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Actually, his semen is more likely the problem, which, I realize is not what you were reacting to.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When's the last time the two of you had unprotected sex?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Never. I use a condom.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You always use a condom... For everything?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Well, for most everything.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: The night before she collapsed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm placing a drop of Nick's semen protein onto the skin. Then I'll abrade it with a needle, check for a rash in an hour or so.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Mom, come on... we've been dating for three years.

utterance.speaker: June
utterance.content: Look, I'm not mad, sweetheart. I'm just, confused.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A systemic reaction can be triggered by the protein in semen. In most cases, the reaction is fairly minor. But in rare cases, repeat exposure can trigger a hypersensitivity response.

utterance.speaker: June
utterance.content: Repeat exposure? Ugh, I know, I know — three years.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Is it supposed to hurt?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The reaction should take longer than...

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: No, it's not that. Ow.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Abby, what's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: My stomach.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Blood in the urine.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Aah! Aah! Aah! Aah! Help me! Aah!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No allergic reaction. On the other hand, now her kidneys are failing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Could be some kind of neuropathy. Syphilitic lightning pains?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not syphilis. VDRL and enzyme immunoassays were negative.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What about a blood clot?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: While she's on anticoagulants from the aortic surgery?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Interstitial nephritis?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wouldn't cause the edema or dissection.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But cancer could.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Would you care to be a little more specific?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If I could, I would have.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We could do a full-body scan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We hate full-body scans.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And by "we" you mean "you." We also hate when a patient dies before we figure out what's wrong with them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do the scan.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How can you convince someone you're not cheating on them?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Don't cheat. After a while, they'll catch on.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What if I don't want to wait that long?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Take them with you wherever you go for 24 hours a day. So your wife's a little insecure. Is that so bad? At least you know she still cares.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know she cares. What I want is, for her to be happy. What? You don't think I want my wife to be happy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sure... As long as it makes you happy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think you work quickly.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Piece of cake, you give them money, they give you furniture. Not bad, huh?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. It's not “bad” at all.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: It's taking a really long time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Just hang in there and try not to talk unless you really have to. It can affect the images.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: What was that? Hello? Are you still there?

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: I think there's something wrong with the machine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not the machine. It's an earthquake. Hold on. We'll get you out.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Get me out now.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Aah! Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Ugh! AAAaaagh! AAAaahhhhh!

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Oh, my God! I can't hold on!

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: AAaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: It's a black hole.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's hallucinating.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I certainly hope so.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Hallucination means brain problem.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Brain problems don't split your aorta.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A vascular problem could explain both. Inflammation in the blood-vessel walls leads to dissection in the aorta and could cause an aneurysm in the brain that could cause the visions.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's a bit convoluted, but brain and heart function are susceptible too.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Whatcha doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If there was any sign of inflammation of the aorta, that would make sense.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: groceries.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: U don’t want to know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: R u nuts?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House! It's not funny. I got enough problems already.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Trust me. This is gonna help.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: An aneurysm explains the hallucinations. And it's the one thing we haven't excluded from the differential.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your texting does not prove you're faithful. It just proves you know she thinks you're unfaithful. Can't force trust. What did she hallucinate?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The content of the hallucination isn't relevant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not usually.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not ever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We know nothing, brain knows all. You get an ulcer, you don't know it, but the brain increases mucin secretions. It knows what the problem is, knows where the problem is.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's a big logical jump from a body's immune response to the brain giving subconscious diagnostic clues.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about dreaming about waterfalls, running streams if you need to go to the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sure. That's the same as the brain shouting, "you have pancreatic cancer."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Her subconscious is trying to tell her something. We need to eavesdrop.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She was screaming she was being sucked into a black hole, so, we should look for a tumor in her anus?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We need the whole story. The cognitive pattern recognition program might tell us what's going on in her head.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Or we could act on something based in science, not science fiction. Get an MRA with contrast to see if she has an aneurysm, unless you think Cuddy's gonna go for the mind reading.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Do the MRA. When it comes back negative, we can move on to the... crazy but possible ideas.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What did you do with the furniture?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I returned it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You told me to buy it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you didn't buy it. You rented it. You made one phone call to Economy Furniture Supply — "we get it done so you don't have to."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So what? We had a table, chairs —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But no clue what any of it meant.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine. I'll hire a decorator.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Perfect. Another woman to tell you who you are.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'll hire a male decorator.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Step inside one furniture store and find one thing you like.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I like, not doing this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Abby

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Hi. Where's my mom?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: She went down to get some breakfast. How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Well, besides the fact that I can barely breathe and I ache all over, not good.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Anything I can do?

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Just don't go.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: I'm not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Been a while since we've gone more than a day without doing that.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: I'm not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: What'd you say?

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: I've been thinking.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Been a long time since we went more than a day without doing that.

utterance.speaker: Hallucination of Young Abby
utterance.content: We have a secret.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Now, you don't need to answer right now, but... Abby, I want to marry you.

utterance.speaker: Hallucination of Young Abby
utterance.content: Tell him the secret. It's okay.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Something's wrong.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Abby, what are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Hallucination of Young Abby
utterance.content: Your secret is killing you.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: I see, um... maybe it's all the medication. I'm just — um...

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Abby. Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: Hallucination of Young Abby
utterance.content: You deserve to die.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need four milligrams lorazepam.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She seized for over a minute.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Inner-ictal E.E.G. showed no synchronous discharges.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the MRA?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No aneurysms or arterial or venous malformations in the brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As predicted. What did we say we'd move on to?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Out-of-body experiences can be induced by sensory overload in the temporoparietal junction.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Temporoparietal junction was clean on MRI, MRA, and whole-body scan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which just leaves us with the question of, what happened during the out-of-body experience?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If I say her blood pressure shot up over 200 and she bit her tongue, would that be a satisfactory answer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure. If you then went on to answer the following — Did she float above her body? Did she see Jesus? Did she bathe in the Ganges?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, no, and no. Can we get back to the medical science?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She claims she emerged from her body as a younger version of herself and started talking. She couldn't remember what was discussed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But I'm sure it wasn't a differential. House, cognitive pattern recognition is 50 years from being a useful diagnostic tool.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Even if we can get the equipment, it takes hours for the initial mapping. If she has another seizure, she could stroke out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Coincidentally, she could also have a stroke if we do nothing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not telling a mother who's scared out of her mind that our best shot is a magic trick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not magical. It's experimental. Just like washing your hands after pooping once was. And technically, it's not our best shot. I'm pretty sure it's our only shot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Perfect. So, Foreman, go get her consent. The rest of you go down to the cog sci lab. Equipment should already be there.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll catch up.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thanks for the invite. I'm not sure I'm up for the hospital food.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Good, 'cause I wasn't planning on lunch.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: While you watch video clips, a computer maps how your brain processes the images.

utterance.speaker: June
utterance.content: How long will it take?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Six hours. But that's really just the prep. Once the computer maps how she processes the information, we'll put her under twilight sedation, use the same equipment to monitor her unconscious thoughts.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hopefully, it'll spit out a very basic video of whatever's going on in her head.

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: And what will that tell you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hopefully, it'll give us a clue as to where your brain thinks the problem is.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: A lot of "hopefullys."

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Could it hurt her?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're at a diagnostic dead end. We've got to try something.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This is much better than lunch.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I agree.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What made you think of this?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I missed you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I-I mean this — car, in the parking lot. I just don't like feeling like maybe this isn't the first time you've done this.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's the first. I love you. You know that, right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I want you to be able to trust me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And I want to, but —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Inspiration point doesn't open till after dark. Got a real cool magic show about to start. Also, I'm gonna need to check your spare.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Abby, can you think of something specific?

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Doesn't matter. Just make it a single image.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: Abby
utterance.content: About Nick playing baseball.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Holy crap.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's amazing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. Now all we have to do is read her subconscious and hope that it's completely rational and went to med school.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Does anything get you excited?

utterance.speaker: Saleswoman
utterance.content: Can I help you with something?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes. Uh, I was wondering if you could tell me a little bit about this dining table.

utterance.speaker: Saleswoman
utterance.content: It's made of wood, and you eat off it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So you're paid by commission?

utterance.speaker: Saleswoman
utterance.content: It's furniture. Find something you like. Let me know, I’ll ring it up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay, that's — that's not the one.

utterance.speaker: Gabiella
utterance.content: That is a remarkable collection, if I can show it to you. I'm Gabriella.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm really just looking for a nice dining room table.

utterance.speaker: Gabriella
utterance.content: I see. You're daring.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, I do that sometimes, but... right now, why am I daring?

utterance.speaker: Gabriella
utterance.content: You're not constrained by rules. What else attracts you in the patio section?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Wait, this is a patio table — for outside?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Well, it's taken us just over an hour to prove that she has a very boring subconscious.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anyone ever tell you you can be a real buzzkill?

utterance.speaker: All but Foreman
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Stars? Maybe that's a stripe?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's the sky. She's thinking about the moon and the stars and the sky.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's going to Stanford to study physics. It's not a big revelation that she'd think about the sky.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Or, star could be a white blood cell. Leukemia?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who's that?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Her dad? He died when she was eight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did daddy die of?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Um, private-plane crash — no connection.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Stars, moon, sky, white blood cells, heart valves, black holes, or anus, or a million other circular passageways into the body, and her dad.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What do you think it means?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She likes school, and she has daddy issues — Neither of which helps us.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So now what do we do? Start over? We obviously missed something.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What about the liver?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about her left toe? Oh, sorry. I thought we were randomly picking out body parts that had nothing to do with her symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Liver's responsible for proteins, immunological effects, production of red blood cells. Might be able to explain the lungs, the hallucinations.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not the aortic dissection.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kidneys are also failing. We add in polycystic disease, could explain the dissection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So that's one imperfect theory, plus a rare complication of a second theory, which gives us a complete explanation. Don't polish the notion, Foreman.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Pineal gland is calcified.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's supposed to be calcified. Happens after puberty.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What if it's obscuring a tumor? It's the only place we couldn't look inside.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get a better look at her pineal gland with three tesla fast spin echo MRI.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're pacing my office 'cause you're buying furniture?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, I'm pacing your office because I'm physically incapable of buying furniture.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: For Amber's old place?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. Uh, it needs some new —

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know you bought the place I wanted. You're a jerk. Let's move on. Hire a decorator.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm supposed to find, me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Backpack through Europe. I know it's hard to believe, but you know what says even more about who you are than your furniture? The fact that you are letting House tell you how to buy furniture. Call Beatrice.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: MRI revealed no remarkable features on her pineal gland. But there were slightly elevated levels of lactate dehydrogenase isoenzymes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which we would expect to see if there was an allergic reaction happening.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There's definitely no allergy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Parasite? There's this Middle Eastern parasite —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How exactly do you want to be shot down? On the basis of the fact that she's never been within 6,000 miles of the Middle East, or on the basis of the fact that all our scans and urine samples came back clean? And yet she’s still failing, system after system. So, either we find the answer at autopsy or...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I got nothin'.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was gonna head out. If there's any change, I assume you'll page me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you having an affair? Does it bother you that your wife doesn't have the guts to actually ask that question, and I do?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: On both ends, yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Difference is, I'm not afraid of the answer. And I might believe you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not having an affair.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you want to.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, I don't. I'm through living like that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why? What, you finally got to the point where half your age plus seven just isn't young enough?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Talk to you later, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or is it because you now really are old enough to be their — The dad. Does he travel for work?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What do you mean, "does he"? He died almost ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not hers, her boyfriend's. He's the one in her visions.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm your son's girlfriend's doctor.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a mouthful, but probably not as tricky as your title.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Um, okay. Is Abby gonna be all right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you travel a lot?

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Yeah, I have a food-import business. Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where'd you go?

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: All over — France, Italy, the mediterranean. Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think you exposed her to a parasite.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Oh. I thought the scans didn't show any.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because she doesn't have any.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: But you just said —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's cool. My theory is that her body was able to kill off the parasite, but what it couldn't do was get rid of the shell, which doesn't show up on the scans. That little piece of microscopic garbage set off an allergic reaction called cerebellar schistosomiasis delayed hypersensitivity allergy, or cusdehaaa. Risky, unpleasant treatment, but completely curable.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Well, that's fantastic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'd think so, wouldn't you? Only thing is, did you ever have sex with your son's girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Where the hell do you get off asking —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Shut up! See, I can't treat this unless I can confirm it, and the only way she could have been exposed to this parasite is sexually, which means she's gonna die very soon unless you admit that you slept with her.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: Dad? What's going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Gee, this is bad, because you now have to choose between her living and the truth becoming public. And frankly, given what the truth is, it's a tough call.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: You'd broken up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your girlfriend is not allergic to your semen. She's allergic to the Egyptian parasite swimming around in your dad's semen.

utterance.speaker: Nick
utterance.content: You slept with Abby?

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: I was drunk. We both...

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No need to explain. Technically, she was legal.

utterance.speaker: Artie
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait. Wait. Wait!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey... All things considered, it's actually great news.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So what do you think?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You wussed out, and used a decorator.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why can't that be me — The wuss who loves decorators?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'cause it's not.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay. It's not. But don't return it. I can't keep doing this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have to. You can't keep letting other people define you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not another elephant.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Decorator didn't pick this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're gonna have to buy your own cape.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like what this says about you, Wilson.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't remember him at the wedding. Do you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't remember most of the people who were at our wedding. Which is why... I thought I'd ask the love of my life to marry me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We're already married.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I want to be better at it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, it's beautiful.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What'd you tell him?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That it doesn't mean she doesn't love him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And he bought it?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's true.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your wife say yes?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How did you know —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Monkey see, monkey do. At least he has the young and stupid excuse.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: She said yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thank you.
